content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the vertices of a parallelogram are located at <math alttext="open parentheses 1 comma 1 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, <math alttext="open parentheses 5 comma 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, <math alttext="open parentheses 2 comma 11 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, and <math alttext="open parentheses 6 comma 13 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>13</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>. What is the area of the parallelogram, in square units?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

topic.text: 4.11: The Inverse and Determinant of a Matrix

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
